page.title: 13Minerals and building
page.content:
The soil is rich and dark alluvial land, supplemented by the regular dredgings from the rivers and the cleanings from the ditches and dykes.
There is open-cast mineral working in the south-east corner of the block, at Tottenhill Row. A fairly small scale sand and gravel operation is carried on, and a large gravel pit/lake has been formed over the years.
There are virtually no stone outcrops in the area, so buildings are constructed of brick, except for some very old stone cottages, and for the school and two churches, all of stone.
